I'd highly recommend "Divergent" for you! It's a thrilling story set in a dystopian future where society is divided into factions based on virtues. The protagonist, Tris, discovers she doesn't fit into any one faction, and as danger looms, she must uncover the truth about Divergents before it's too late. Jim Carter isn't in this film, but Shailene Woodley delivers an outstanding performance. If you enjoy action-packed, thought-provoking movies, I think you'll really enjoy Divergent!

Alternatively, "Man on Wire" is another fantastic choice if you're interested in a more historical and suspenseful story. It chronicles Philippe Petit's daring high-wire walk between the World Trade Center towers in 1974. Jean-Louis Blondeau, one of the key figures in this true tale, gives an unforgettable performance. Enjoy the awe-inspiring journey and the artistic crime that captivated the world!
